Procedure.Name: help3toggle_myMouseDown

CommentLines.CommentLine: ' Purpose : help3toggle is the topmost so it receives all the clicks
Dim fileToPlay As String: fileToPlay = vbNullString
Dim helpToggleFlg As Boolean: helpToggleFlg = False
If gblEnableSounds = "1" And fFExists(App.path & "\resources\sounds\" & fileToPlay) Then
PlaySound App.path & "\resources\sounds\" & fileToPlay, ByVal 0&, SND_FILENAME Or SND_ASYNC
Call screenWrite("Help Dropdown canvas No. 2 visible " & helpToggleFlg)
MsgBox "Error " & Err.Number & " (" & Err.Description & ") in procedure help1toggle_myMouseDown of Class Module cfClock"
' Purpose : help3toggle is the topmost so it receives all the clicks
Dim fileToPlay As String: fileToPlay = vbNullString
Dim helpToggleFlg As Boolean: helpToggleFlg = False
If gblEnableSounds = "1" And fFExists(App.path & "\resources\sounds\" & fileToPlay) Then
PlaySound App.path & "\resources\sounds\" & fileToPlay, ByVal 0&, SND_FILENAME Or SND_ASYNC
Call screenWrite("Help Dropdown canvas No. 3 visible " & helpToggleFlg)
MsgBox "Error " & Err.Number & " (" & Err.Description & ") in procedure help2toggle_myMouseDown of Class Module cfClock"
Purpose : help3toggle is the topmost so it receives all the clicks

Procedure.Declaration: Private Sub help3toggle_myMouseDown()

Procedure.Name: clockForm_MouseUp

CommentLines.CommentLine: Purpose : if this is a multi monitor system then:
we note the monitor ID at clockForm form_load and store as the clockFormMonitorID, for widgetPrefs widgetPrefsMonitorID

on clockFromMouseUp (drag complete) we sample the monitor ID again -only works, for the prefs form we have to have a 200ms timer that tests for form .left and .top x,y change (no MOVED event and mouse UP does not work on the form itself when the titlebar dragged)
if the monitor has changed then sample the physical monitor resolution
if the resolution is different then calculate new size proportion
alter the size of the form to correspond to the monitor

Procedure.Declaration: Private Sub clockForm_MouseUp(ByRef Button As Integer, ByRef Shift As Integer, ByRef x As Single, ByRef y As Single)

Procedure.Name: W_Paint

CommentLines.CommentLine: Purpose : this is run when the graphics are initially placed on the screen, refreshing and when a mouse cursor is interacting

Procedure.Declaration: Private Sub W_Paint(ByRef CC As cCairoContext, ByVal xAbs As Single, ByVal yAbs As Single, ByVal dx_Aligned As Single, ByVal dy_Aligned As Single, UserObj As Object)

Public Function fCurrentScreenHeight(Optional bSubtractTaskbar As Boolean = False)
' This works even on Tablet PC. The problem is: when the tablet screen is rotated, the "Screen" object of VB doesn't pick it up.
' The taskbar is typically 30 pixels or 450 twips, or, at least, this is the assumption made here.
' It can actually be multiples of this, or possibly moved to the side or top.
' This procedure does not account for these possibilities.
Purpose : at startup obtains monitor ID and characteristics
in addition, if there is more than one screen, size the form by a ratio according to the form's physical monitor properties

Procedure.Declaration: Public Sub positionClockByMonitorSize()

Purpose : VB6 standard form to display the prefs

Property.Name: ToolTipText
Property.Value: Save the changes you have made to the preferences

Property.Name: ToolTipText
Property.Value: Check the box to show the widget in the taskbar

Property.Name: ToolTipText
Property.Value: Check the box to make the program DPI aware. RESTART required.

Property.Name: ToolTipText
Property.Value: Check the box to show the widget in the taskbar

Property.Name: ToolTipText
Property.Value: To change the direction of the mouse scroll wheel when resiziing the globe gauge.

Property.Name: Caption
Property.Value: High DPI scaled screens need DPI awareness switched on, older monitors work best without. When enabling, you will need to close and restart the program. A reload won't cut it.

Property.Name: Caption
Property.Value: The scroll-wheel resizing direction can be determined here. The direction chosen causes the gauge to grow. *

Property.Name: ToolTipText
Property.Value: To change the direction of the mouse scroll wheel when resiziing the globe gauge.

Here you can choose whether this Pz Earth widget is hidden by default in either landscape or portrait mode or not at all. This option allows you to have certain widgets that do not obscure the screen in either landscape or portrait. If you accidentally set it so you can't find your widget on screen then change the setting here to NONE.

Property.Name: ToolTipText
Property.Value: Opens a browser window and sends you to our donate page on Amazon

Property.Name: Text
Property.Value:
PANZER EARTH WIDGET
The Panzer Earth Widget is a utility displays a rotating earth in a dieselpunk fashion on your desktop. It can be resized and placed anywhere on your desktop. It uses minimal resources and helps give your desktop a dieselpunk make-over.
Right-click on the widget to display the function menu, mouse hover over the widget and press CTRL+mousewheel up/down to resize. It works well on Windows XP to Windoes 11 (sic).
This version was developed on Windows 7 using 32 bit VisualBasic 6 as a FOSS project creating WoW64 widget for the desktop.
It is open source to allow easy configuration, bug-fixing, enhancement and community contribution towards free-and-useful VB6 utilities that can be created by anyone. The first step was the creation of this template program to form the basis for other desktop utilities or 'widgets'. A future step is new VB6 widgets with more functionality and then hopefully, conversion of each to RADBasic/TwinBasic for future-proofing and 64bit- ness.
This utility is one of a set of steampunk and dieselpunk widgets. That you can find here on Deviantart: https://www.deviantart.com/yereverluvinuncleber/gallery
I do hope you enjoy using this utility and others. Your own software enhancements and contributions will be gratefully received if you choose to contribute.
CREDITS:
I have really tried to maintain the credits as the project has progressed. If I have made a mistake and left someone out then do forgive me. I will make amends if anyone points out my mistake in leaving someone out.
Olaf Schmidt - This tool was built using the RichClient RC5 Cairo wrapper for VB6.
Shuja Ali @ codeguru for his settings.ini code.
ALLAPI.COM For the registry reading code.
Rxbagain on codeguru for his Open File common dialog code without a dependent OCX http://forums.codeguru.com/member.php?92278-rxbagain
si_the_geek for his special folder code
Aaron Young for his code for registering a keypress system wide
Elroy on VB forums for the balloon tooltips
